inclusion.criterion: Females 18 years of age and older at screening.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Term pregnancies of 37 to 42 weeks gestation, scheduled to undergo elective C-section.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: American Society of Anesthesiology (ASA) physical status 1, 2, or 3.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Able to provide informed consent, adhere to the study visit schedule, and complete all study assessments.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Subjects who, in the opinion of the study site principal investigator, have a high-risk pregnancy (eg, multiple gestations, pregnancy resulting from in vitro fertilization, gestational diabetes, end-term prolonged bed rest required for medical reasons).
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Subjects with a pregnancy-induced medical condition or complication (eg, hypertension, pre-eclampsia, chorioamnionitis).
exclusion.label: met
exclusion.evidence: The patient has hypercholesterolemia and two C/sections.

exclusion.criterion: Subjects with 3 or more prior C-sections.
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: The patient has only two C/sections.

notes: The patient is a 45-year-old woman with abdominal pain lasting about 4 days accompanied by nausea and 2 episodes of vomiting. She has hypercholesterolemia and two C/sections, but no high-risk pregnancy or pregnancy-induced medical condition.
